alert.note: Alert for Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 10:49AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ware and northwestern Charlton Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1049 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Manor, or near Argyle, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds around 40 mph, minor flooding due to heavy rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Manor and Needham. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton
